Crimes.Legal_Issue: Risk of intimidation upon return to Bangladesh and eligibility for protection under Canadian immigration law
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: 34 documents submitted; most repetitive, three letters analyzed but not materially new
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate personal risk and new evidence
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Section 113 requires new evidence arising after or unavailable at time of original claim
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Compliance with PRRA requirements under Section 113
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Political activities and involvement in a documentary exposing corruption
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Claim dismissed on merits due to lack of new evidence
Crimes.Review_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied by Federal Court
Key_Evidence_Considered: three letters from contacts in Bangladesh
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Argued ongoing risk due to political exposure
Crimes.Defendant_Response: No direct response; decision based on record
Crimes.Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board, PRRA officer, Federal Court
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Fear of intimidation due to political opinion and activism

Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Lack of personalization of risk to applicant

Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Validity of PRRA submission under statutory framework

Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Claim dismissed for insufficient new evidence

Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Fear of retaliation by security forces
